title: In the Saadé family, there is no boundary between business and private life
summary: 'Successions,' season 3 (3/6). Rodolphe Saadé succeeded his father Jacques at the helm of CMA CGM in 2017, a year before his death. The heir is now preparing the third generation to run the family business, today a shipping, logistics and media giant.

title: Democratic convention opens with Biden's farewell: 'I love the job, but I love my country more'
summary: The Democratic convention that will make Vice President Harris's candidacy official runs until Thursday. Monday night's speakers included Hillary Clinton, who declared that 'something is happening in America – you can feel it.'

title: Jean Garrigues, historian: 'We can draw some political lessons from these happy days of Olympism'
summary: The nationalism of French supporters was one of openness, fraternity and inclusion, the antithesis of the closed, exclusionary nationalism that the far right has cultivated since the end of the 19th century, the historian pointed out in an op-ed for 'Le Monde.'

title: EU plans 36% tariff on Chinese EVs, with lower duty for Tesla
summary: The European Commission said Tuesday it plans to slap five-year import duties on Chinese electric cars, unless Beijing can offer an alternative solution to the trade row over state subsidies.

title: In Germany, conviction of a former Nazi camp secretary upheld
summary: Judges at the Federal Court of Justice in Leipzig, Germany's highest civil and criminal court, have affirmed on appeal that even low-level workers can be convicted of complicity in mass murder.

title: 'The risk of China canceling out the benefits of international trade is worrying'
summary: Economist Laurent Augier recalls that a 2004 article by Nobel Prize-winning economist Paul Samuelson anticipated a situation in which the theory of comparative advantages, the 'doxa' of globalization, would no longer apply.

title: Blinken says 'time is of the essence' for Gaza truce as he returns to Washington
summary: US Secretary of State Anthony Blinken said Monday in Tel Aviv that Israel has accepted a proposal by the United States to bridge the gaps between the two sides and urged Hamas to follow suit. Media reports however quoted Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu as saying his government would insist on keeping control.

title: Arnaud and Jean-Marie Larrieu, co-directors of 'Jim's Story': 'Kindness, fragility and reliability in boys is not often portrayed'
summary: The filmmaker brothers conceived their film as a tribute to the bonds that can be forged between people outside of blood relations.

title: Channel crossings are becoming increasingly deadly for migrants
summary: Twenty-five people have perished at sea since the start of the year, more than in 2023 and 2022. Many died of asphyxiation in overcrowded dinghies.

title: In South Africa, a new generation of winemakers in search of quality
summary: 'Africa, land of wines' (1/4). Breaking away from the mass production of cooperatives, independent winemakers are striving to upmarket local blends, some of which are now ranked among the best in the world.

title: After Tel Aviv bombing, Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad threaten further attacks in Israel
summary: The claim of a powerful explosion on Sunday raised the specter of suicide bombings, while numerous attacks have been committed on Israel's territory since the massacre on October 7, 2023.

title: Greenland court rejects whaling activist Captain Paul Watson's appeal
summary: The 73-year-old was arrested in Nuuk, Greenland's capital, on July 21 based on a 2012 Interpol arrest warrant issued by Japan, which accuses him of causing damage to one of its whaling ships in 2010 in the Antarctic and causing injury.

title: Juice probe attempts unprecedented Moon-Earth flyby on its way to Jupiter
summary: To optimize its trajectory and save fuel, the probe will take advantage of gravitational assists from the Moon and Earth, passing close to them.

title: Kylian Mbappé counterattacks to reclaim unpaid sums from PSG
summary: Le Monde has learned the Real Madrid player, who is claiming nearly €55 million from his former club, has referred the matter to the legal committee of the French Professional Football League, as well as to UEFA, via the French Football Federation.

title: King Charles III meets survivors of child stabbings that sparked riots
summary: The 75-year-old monarch inspected a vast sea of floral tributes laid outside Southport town hall in memory of the victims – Bebe King, Elsie Dot Stancombe and Alice da Silva Aguiar.

title: Ukraine MPs vote to ban Russia-linked Orthodox Church
summary: Kyiv has been trying to curb spiritual ties with Russia for years – a process that was accelerated by Moscow's 2022 invasion, which the powerful Russian Orthodox Church endorsed.

title: Afghan refugees in Iran targeted by deportation campaign
summary: Some 20 online petitions are calling for the deportation of Afghan nationals to their neighboring country. The movement, orchestrated on social media, has the tacit support of the authorities.

title: India's Supreme Court orders task force after protests over doctor's rape and murder
summary: In response to a week of furious protests, India's top court has ordered a task force to examine how to increase security for medical workers after the rape and murder of a doctor in Kolkata.

title: Brazilians 'struggling to breathe' as Amazon burns
summary: On Tuesday,  the concentration of cancer-causing microparticles known as PM2.5 reached 56.5 micrograms per cubic meter of air in Porto Velho – 11 times more than the limit recommended by the World Health Organization.

title: 'Hope is making a comeback,' Michelle Obama tells DNC attendees in Chicago to support Harris
summary: 'Something magically wonderful is in the air,' the former first lady told adoring attendees ahead of former president Barack Obama's address.

title: Africa, the new frontline between the West and Russia
summary: 'Russia's conquest of Africa' (1/3). The Kremlin has successfully deployed a military presence and media influence on the continent, surprising the West. A year after the death of Yevgeny Prigozhin, founder of the Wagner paramilitary group that spearheaded the breakthrough, Putin's Russia is no longer hiding its intentions.

title: At the Democratic convention, the Obamas portray Harris as the American dream's embodiment
summary: Barack and Michelle Obama, as well as the presidential candidate's husband, Doug Emhoff, appeared on the second day of the Democratic National Convention. Kamala Harris was officially nominated.

title: Row between France and Algeria raises questions on deportation procedures
summary: Since President Emmanuel Macron's change of position on Western Sahara, Algiers may be tempted to prevent the return of nationals France wants to deport. NGOs are concerned about the legality of their lengthened detentions.

title: Disinformation: Mpox epidemic reawakens Covid-era conspiracy theories
summary: With talk of 'plandemic,' Bill Gates meddling, laboratory engineering or Big Pharma conspiracy, the public health emergency declared by the World Health Organization is rekindling the obsessions of conspiracy theorists.

title: Jacques Audiard, director of 'Emilia Perez': 'I must have a particular interest in the screw-ups, the misfits'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the filmmaker explains how he is particularly inspired by marginal characters, especially for his new film, which won several awards at the Cannes Film Festival.

title: The top music festivals in France between now and the end of August
summary: From jazz in Nice to world music on Tatihou Island, here's Le Monde's pick of the best summer music festivals to enjoy all over France this August.

title: In eastern Ukraine, the last free days of Pokrovsk's maternity hospital
summary: Staff and management of the facility are preparing to evacuate the city, as Russian fighters are now only about 10 kilometers away. Moscow's army continues to advance, despite Ukrainian forces' efforts to slow them down by launching an offensive in the border region of Kursk.

title: US presidential election: With Harris, Democrats take back banner of freedom from Republicans
summary: The two parties are engaged in an ideological and political battle over this cardinal American value, long confiscated by conservatives, but with which the Democratic candidate wants to reconcile the progressive camp.

title: France's outgoing prime minister proposes spending freeze in 2025
summary: Documents sent out to ministries by Gabriel Attal on Tuesday plan for a budget similar to this year's. But it will be up to the future government to formally approve it or not.

title: Alain Delon's funeral set for Saturday
summary: The famed actor had asked to be buried at his property in Douchy-Montcorbon, a village in central France.

title: Moscow's winning return to Africa
summary: In 10 years, Vladimir Putin has succeeded in re-establishing Russia's military and diplomatic influence on the African continent, to the detriment of the West and France in particular.

title: Ukraine parliament votes to join International Criminal Court
summary: Ukraine signed the Rome Statute that founded the court in 2000 but did not ratify it, with some political and military figures expressing fears that Ukrainian soldiers could face prosecution.

title: The mpox vaccine response starts to get organized
summary: The African continent, the epicenter of the epidemic, is hoping to receive the first deliveries of the vaccine manufactured in Denmark.

title: Imran Khan applies from prison to be chancellor of Oxford University
summary: The former prime minister, who has been in prison for a year, fears being court-martialed.

title: Madeira wildfire threatens UNESCO-listed forest
summary: Portuguese authorities sent reinforcements to the island of Madeira on August 21 to fight a wildfire raging for a week.

title: Israel kills Fatah commander in Lebanon strike
summary: Khalil al-Maqdah was killed in a strike on his car in the southern Lebanese city of Sidon, according to Fatah and a Lebanese security source.

title: Boeing suspends 777X flight tests after part failure
summary: Boeing is studying the faulty part on its 777-9 model and 'will resume flight testing when ready,' it said.

title: French left prepares its own 2025 budget
summary: MPs in the Nouveau Front Populaire left-wing alliance are preparing a draft budget, in case the coalition is called upon to form a government. It includes a targeted investment and infrastructure plan that could reach €10 billion.

title: France undermining Kanak rights in restive New Caledonia, say UN experts
summary: According to UN special rapporteurs, the bill in question 'threatens to dismantle other achievements of the Nouméa Accord relating to the recognition of the Kanak Indigenous identity, Kanak customary institutions as well as customary law and land rights.'

title: At Nice Jazz Fest, rapper Nas celebrates a career spanning 30 years
summary: Moved to the end of August because of the Paris Olympics, this increasingly eclectic festival welcomed the son of trumpeter Olu Dara for its opening night.

title: The Rothschilds' heavy name
summary: 'Successions,' season 3' (4/6). Personal rivalries and business conflicts have often strained relations between the different branches of this banking family whose history spans several centuries.

title: Iran's hard-line parliament approves all members of president's cabinet
summary: This is the first time in over two decades a leader has been able to get all of his officials through the body. It includes the first female minister in over a decade.

title: Police shoot man who set fire at French town hall
summary: In the western French city of Angoulême, a 46-year-old burst into the 19th-century building and poured petrol around a first-floor room where two women aides to local councilors were working.

title: Divers find four bodies in Sicily superyacht wreckage
summary: UK tech tycoon Mike Lynch and his teenage daughter Hannah are among the six people still missing after the sinking of the British-flagged 'Bayesian' superyacht.

title: Altice: Executive dismissed during corruption scandal sues company
summary: Dismissed on August 2, 2023, a few days after the start of the Pereira scandal, Tatiana Agova-Bregou is contesting an 'abusive' and 'vexing' dismissal.

title: Central bankers' independence is under growing political pressure
summary: The world's leading central bankers are gathering for three days in Jackson Hole, Wyoming, for the Fed's traditional annual symposium.

title: Trump holds first outdoor rally since assassination attempt, speaks behind bulletproof glass
summary: A bulletproof screen could be seen around the podium where Trump and his vice presidential pick, J.D. Vance, addressed the crowd in Asheboro, North Carolina on Wednesday. At one point during his speech, Trump left the stage and entered the crowd to check on an attendee who was suffering a medical issue.

title: In retaliation for possible taxation of its electric vehicles, China launches anti-dumping investigation into EU dairy products
summary: China's Ministry of Commerce will examine possible European anti-competitive practices concerning fresh cheese, blue cheese and other dairy specialties. Beijing has already targeted pork and spirits.
